reviews.review: Bought it because it was on specially and heard good things about it, but I never expected it to be this good!! Story is awesome,  visuals are brilliant and I don't even like first person shooter games, this is more than just a FPS shooter!!
Good if you like rpg's but if you like unlocking and upgrading also this can be quite boring then because there isnt many unlocks or upgrades but still worth it
Probably the best of the Bioshock series.  Story is great, gameplay is great, I enjoyed the hell out of this game and anyone who says differently was probably dropped on their head as a baby. 10/10

As far as first person shooters go this game is above average.  What I feel makes Infinite stand out is the story line.  If you enjoy trying to guess the plot before it is revealed then this game should give you a whirl.

Буду краток: "Игра вынесла мне мозг!". И как сказал один мой друг: "Это больше, чем просто шедевр". Я бесспорно согласен с этим. BioShock Infinite - это полотно великого мастера Кена Левина, который доказывает всему миру, что игры - это искусство, и что они могут уделавать в сюжете любые другие художественые произведения в мире книг и кино. Об оценке даже речь не идет. 

                                                                                                           Infinite (Бесконечность) из 10

P.S. Я не просто советую вам поиграть в BioShock Infinite. ВЫ ОБЯЗАНЫ ПРОЙТИ ЕГО, НИЧЕГО НЕ ПОНЯТЬ, ПОТОМ ПРОЙТИ ЕЩЕ РАЗ И ОПЯТЬ НИЧЕГО НЕ ПОНЯТЬ, А ПОТОМ ПРОЙТИ В ТРЕТИЙ РАЗ, ПОНЯТЬ ВСЕ, ПРИЗНАТЬ ЕГО ШЕДЕВРОМ И ИДТИ РАЗБИРАТЬ НА ЦИТАТЫ!!!

Bioshock Infinite brings a new tale to the fantastic franchise we all know and love. Although a Bioshock game, it does not take place in Rapture as it did in the previous games; Instead Columbia, a city suspended in mid-air by kinetic energies. This story rich game will keep you on your toes for countless hours from start to finish.

Pros:

- Sleek style
- Captivating environment
- Absolutely lovely characters
- Fantastic voice acting
- Great gameplay mechanics

Cons:

- Occasionally cheasy vocal acting. Not bad, just humerous as it is typical in 2 small parts of the game
- Shorter game than I would have liked

All around awesome story and mechanics. The only downside is there is little replayability for me since, unlike bioshock 1, you can't romp around previous levels with the skills you have at completion.
This game is soo amazing....
This game just blew my freaking mind.

After countless debates in the industry concerning whether or not video games can be considered art, Bioshock: Infinite has come along to silence them. An accomplishment in story telling and the crafting of a world so imaginative in terms of originality and intrigue, it should rest proudly amongst any collection of games (along with the original Bioshock) as the ending to a series of pointless arguments. Not many games can be considered as such, but this one can hold its head up high and know it’s definitively so.

A rather grand departure from Rapture, Columbia is beautiful, sunny and filled with racist albeit, happy people. Rapture was a special place too but it was a deserted wasteland at the bottom of the sea, littered with as many ideals as bodies. A complete shift in atmosphere, Infinite trades dark, lonely and claustrophobic for an effulgent and spacious place with a creepy sense of community. The micro-interactions you encounter with the hundreds of lively people walking around and chatting about Columbia are mind blowing when recalling the hours spent alone in the corridors of Andrew Ryan’s sunken utopia.

There’s a moment for everyone with a pulse. Maybe it’s when the wind pushes a lonely beach umbrella across the sand or even one as obvious as when the doors open, exposing a sprawling and floating city landscape. Regardless of how or when, it will come and when it does, it will devastate you. After all, Columbia feels lighter than air.

A man with a debt is barely a man at all. Desperate for the opportunity to escape his burden, Booker Dewitt takes a less than favorable job, his deal: “Bring us the girl, wipe away the debt”. Before he knows it, he’s on a boat in the middle of the ocean. A lighthouse stands cloaked in solace, a storm rages above. The darken clouds scream and weep at his arrival. Atop a chair awaits, whisking him above the angry effervescence to the gleam of perfect blue skies and sunshine.

A somber yet delightful patter of keys roll over, a tune of emptiness plays as he floats down upon the city of Columbia, a place that itself is made of more empty spaces than concrete or brick. A burgh gliding all around the world, a shining example of American exceptionalism, powered by the word and will of demagogue Zachary Hale Comstock.  His title of “Prophet” is a dangerous one, every time his visions come true his following grows in size and belief. Subsequently, they perceive Comstock’s prejudice as yet another prophecy.

As Jeremiah Fink tells us in relation to all this “prophecy business”, belief is a commodity. It’s apparent just how popular a product it is to the people of Columbia when it’s plastered on every wall, hanging from every ledge and shouted from the voice of every citizen standing at street’s corner. Comstock knows he won’t be around forever the same way he knows belief isn’t cheap, so he’s planting seeds that will influence them to follow another. “The seed of the Prophet shall sit the throne and drown in flame, the mountains of man.”

Elizabeth like any Disney princess is beautiful, clever and highly capable. Years spent locked away from a city that desperately needed her haven’t been wasted. She prides herself on knowing a great bit from all she’s read. Among those piles of books and the heaps of knowledge she ascertained, she’s read enough about lock picking to pick any door in Columbia. Coupled with her ability to create tears into reality, which allow Booker to select a tactical option on the battlefield, whether it be an automated turret or a weapon or a med kit, she is an incendiary addition to your already stunning arsenal.

As for your arsenal, it’s very punchy. Every vigor is colorful and brimming with power.  Every weapon is finely tuned and accurate, all while delivering that explosive punch.  The weapons aren’t overly original, mostly following the familiar tropes of shotgun, rifle, machine gun and RPG, but it was clear the intention was that originality be left to the vigors. The guns are the constants and the vigors are the variables. Coupling variables can be awfully fun, whether it be the lifting powers of bucking bronco and devil’s kiss exploding them mid-air or activating return to sender’s shield and going to town against some founders with undertow, blasting them off many ledges or knocking them down with the sole intent of purchasing more time to re-activate your shield, the combat is pure and fun though hardly the selling point of Bioshock: Infinite.

Anyone who came expecting a revolution to First Person shooters will be greatly disappointed and while grinding against sky-rails, firing upon deserving enemies can be seen as revolutionary, the true revolution of Bioshock: Infinite is it’s story. Nothing here feels like game filler, if you lose a character or the figurative ground you were standing on crumbles, it feels earned. The only derailment that occurs is whenever Booker detaches from a sky-rail, hanging over his destination.

Stunning visuals, an excellent cast of characters and an intensely arresting concept are the recipe for most great pieces of art and Infinite is no different. Not every video game is art, the same way not every movie or book is; the only difference is that in this medium, the occurrence of art is a lot less common. Which makes Infinite a welcome sight. Floating just out of the reach of perfection, Bioshock: Infinite tells a grand and masterful tale with greater consistency than the original. Columbia may seem far away to most but to any true gamer, a charter will always remain a permanent fixture inside their heart.

This exceeded all of my expectations for a wrap up to the Bioshock series. The plot is amazing and completely tied together in a way that I didn't think would be possible. This is officially one of my favorite series of all time. This story explores the true definition of sacrifice and should make everyone think twice about the choices that they make in life. WOW.

With a combination of shooting, and vigor powers this game keeps you moving, and even in the slow parts the artwork is enough to keep your entertained.

OUF! Ça a fait le tour de l'histoire finalement! (Vient à l'instant de finir Burial at Sea Ep.2)

J'ai adoré du début a la fin, autant dans columbia, qu'au travers des deux DLC. Ken Levine et irrational games a fait un sacré boulot, autant côté scénario que gameplay. L'un des meilleurs jeu que j'ai joué, peut-être même le meilleur. Bon, certain gens critiquent la *SPOILER* non-happy-ending, mais ça dépend du point de vue.
Bioshock, c'est un univers, tant de choses a explorer, sans rien enlever à l'histoire au contraire, plus on explore, plus on se rend compte de la complexité de l'histoire.

Après ça, je pense que je vais me retapper Bioshock 1!

I reviewed this game a few years back and I decided to give it a go again for some nostalgia. It's a great game to kill some time with and the story is... well... interesting to say the least. Don't get me wrong, this is a fun game and I recommend it to anyone who likes the Bioshock series, but I can see why people don't like it as well. I haven't played the other Bioshock games myself, but it seems that this wasn't as great as the others which is sad. I personally think that this game has everything anyone would want in it. A decent story, good combat system, cool power-ups, and an assortment of different guns and things you can do with the environment. I personally LOVE the rail system, it's epic and a lot of fun to jump off onto enemies! Columbia is also incredibly beautiful when you first start out in the city. I've seriously spent way too much time looking at the view, it's honestly just breath taking. The DLC for the game is passable tho, I didn't exactly think it was exciting, just something to do with my spare time I guess. If you got that spare time as well and a little money lying around, I'd say give the game a go. I still have fun with it today even after I've played it through at least 5 times. This game will always have a special place in my heart, and even though it's not a fantastic game, I'd still recommend to anyone looking for a little fun.

" Приведи девчёнку , и мы в растчёте "
      С этого и начинается игра . Для меня игра является шедевром , в который стоит поиграть , но меня сильно разочаровала 
      концовка . Но давайте расставим все точки над и . Всё поначалу всё начинается для серии , как обычно начинался пер-
      Bioshock. Вы в роли детектива , которого зовут Букер Девитт прибывайте к старому маяку с одной целью ; доставить де-
      вушку Элизабет в Нью-Йорк . Задание как бы - простое , но в тоже время интригующие . 
               Когда в первые я увидел Колубию , меня поразило насколько всё красиво проработано . Люди о чём-то беседуют ,
      ну или рассказывают всякие сплетни и слухи , дети бегают , то есть город живёт своей жизнью . Но когда главный герой 
      выйгравший лотерею видит , что выйграшем является кинуть в пару людей разных рас , то тогда от вас зависит выбор :
      кинуть в пару или в ведущего ( и вот тут зависит выбор , который повлеяет на подальшое развитие событий ) . И в игре
      таких моментов будет придостаточно . 
               При первой встречи с Элизабет игрок чувствует , как бы некую притягательность и няшность ; и когда выбравшись 
      с ней из башни она начинает изучать окружаюший ею мир . Тоесть до самого финала ты переживаеш эмоции , чувства 
      героев и многое другое .
               Ну что можно сказать о геймплее и боевой системе в целом . Геймплей , как и в первых частях состоит из всяких
      заданий и прослушки аудиозаписей разных личностей и персонажей всего основного действия . Боевая ситема немно-
      го раждражает . С ней таже проблема , что и в предыдущих частях . Ну и конечно усилители , с ним проблем нет . Ну
      бывает что соли заканчиваются . 
               Что мы имеем в итоге : интерсный и интригующий сюжет , элементы стимпанка и дизельпанка , харизматичных 
       персонажей , няшку года , лучщую игру прошлого года , но есть одна маленькая проблема - это концовка . Нет не 
       спорю , концовка получилась мрачной и впечитляющей , но сильно обрывистой . 
                                                                                                                                            Моя отценка игре   -    10 из 10
                                                                                                                                И то получилось  завыщеной для  меня

Vermutlich bin ich einer der sehr Wenigen, die das Spiel NICHT gut finden. Ich finde den Protagonisten De Booker dermaßen unsympathisch, dass mich nach kurzer Spielzeit bereits seine Stimme genervt hat. Auch die Kämpfe laufen IMMER nach dem selben Schema ab: Man(n) kommt in ein großes, neues Gebiet und kann sich HUNDERT Prozent sicher sein, dass jeden Moment die Hölle losbricht und aus allen Ecken haufenweise Gegner strömen. Anfangs mag das noch spannend oder herausfordernd sein, doch nach dem x-ten Mal ist es einfach nur LANGWEILIG, zumal die Kämpfe selbst zwar dank Spezialfähigkeiten hübsch anzusehen sind, taktisch aber völlig lahm gemacht sind. Elisabeth ist natürlich ein äußerst starker Charakter, auf den sich die Entwickler offensichtlich mehr konzentriert haben als auf den Rest des Spiels. Die Levelgestaltung ist sehr hübsch anzusehen, das Szenario von fliegenden Städten auch noch unverbraucht. Doch da die Kulisse ausschließlich für die besagten öden Kämpfe herhalten muss, trübt es das Gesamtbild schon wieder.

Ich BIN defintiv ein großer Fan der beiden ersten Teile, die amtosphärisch und erzählerisch immer noch der absolute Hammer sind. Der dritte Teil mitsamt seiner ebenfalls nett gemachten, aber doch nicht fesselnden Addons ist und bleibt eine herbe Enttäuschung für mich.

Buy this game now. Do it.

Easily one of the best looking games ever made. Quite addicting as a FPS and the story is great once you understand it. Irrational Games have purposely designed the game so exploration is rewarded, wether it be Elizabeth being intrigued by something she hasn't seen before, or checking a random office and getting an audio log revealing how the city of Columbia was founded. Speaking of Columbia, Columbia has hundreds of things to see, people to interact with, and a dark underbelly which can be pretty extreme to some.  Some say Columbia is a character in itself, and I for one; agree.

I recommend this game to people who are looking for a unique, action-packed game with a crazy story and even crazier enemies. For Bioshock 1 & 2 fans, you will without a doubt enjoy this game. I can't begin to explain how well put together this game is. Well done Irrational Games, well done.

Колумбия намного интереснее чем Восторг. Первый и второй биошок меня отталкивал своей сыростью и мрачностью. В этой игре красиво ВСЕ. Город, Элизабет, Музыка и т.д и т.п.

С боем в игре тоже все впорядке. Ты носишься по аэротрассе, прыгает по крюкам, постоянно стреляешь и уворачиваешься. Кстати, советую начинать игру как минимум на "Тяжелом", тогда ощутите весь кайф.

В первых частях мне почему то было совершенно не интересно использовать плазвмиды. Их было много, и они совершенно не цепляли. Здесь энергетиков не сильно много, но каждый очень полезный (кроме того их можно комбенировать!)

The "Good":
- Great scenery
- Great dialog
- A very interesting and intriguing story

The "Bad":
- Really slow recovery time. If you're hit, you stay stunned for too long and typically die
- Slow response time when perfoming an action -- usually have to hit and hold F repeatedly
And worst of all:
- The final fight

The final fight made me so mad that I ended up quitting and uninstalling the game. Seriously, I was so close to finishing the game but they made the final fight so ridiculous that even after attempting it 20 times I still couldn't. When you're that close to the ending does it have to be ridiculously difficult - even when you drop the settings to "Easy"?

Bottom line:
- Fun game if you get it on sale for really cheap (I mean CHEAP)
- Don't believe all the hype about this game - sure it's pretty and has a great story but the it's a pain dealing with the poor response time, poor controls and the final fight
Ce jeu magnifique je le conseille vraiment ! mon coup de coeur ! *-*

Great Game

Finalmente terminei esse jogo e suas DLCs e posso escrever uma analise que talvez o faça justiça. Bioshock Infinite é um jogo único, assim como o primeiro jogo da serie, mas de uma forma um pouco diferente. Os gráficos, efeitos sonoros e jogabilidade são perfeitos para este tipo de jogo, mas o real trunfo de jogo é a historia. Cheia de mistérios e reviravoltas você realmente vai se surpreender e amar o que vai ver: Isso é muito mais que a historia de um cara salvando uma garota numa cidade voadora, pode ter certeza. Recomendo Infinitamente. 
As DlCs são tão perfeitas como o jogo, embora começam um pouco fracas, logo revelam ser parte da grande historia principal e ser tão empolgante quando ela. Como o primeiro Bioshock, você NÃO PODE DEIXAR DE JOGAR ESSE GAME.
------------------------------

I finally finished this game and its DLCs and I can write a review that might do justice. Bioshock Infinite is a unique game, as well as the first game in the series, but in a slightly different way. The graphics, sound effects and gameplay are perfect for this type of game, but the real asset of the game is the story. Full of mysteries and twists you really will be amazed and love what you will see: This is much more than the story of a guy saving a girl in a flying city, be sure. Infinitely recommend. 
The DLCs are as perfect as the game, they stars a little weak, soon reveal to be part of the big  main story and so exciting as it. As the first Bioshock, you CAN'T NOT  TO PLAY THIS GAME.
I love the story mode and has wonderful grahpics

Пройдя игру со всеми длц на уровне сложности 1999 решил написать свой обзор:
У игры отличная атмосфери и красочные уровни, оч сильные и красочные главные герои как положительные так и отрецательны, а длц burial at sea episode 1,2 показывают персонажей всех частей с новой стороны и сюжет в длц оч захватывающий.
Пройдя первый раз игру еще когда она только вышла на среднем уровне сложности показалось мне достаточно простой но вот 1999 показал игру с другой стороны где надо действительно делать все четко и думать где лутше какой тоник использавать так что для тех кто думает что игра легка ставте этот уровень сложности и сразу поменяете мнения. Так же хочю сказать что орегинальная озвучка игры по мойму одна из лутших на севоднешний момент могу вспомнить еще разве что игры типа Mass Effect и Batmana с таким же уровнем озвучки . Так что люди не жалейте денег покупайте игра действительно стоит своих денег.
О Боже... Эта самая самая игра)))))

This game is trying pretty damn hard to stop me from replaying it again, DLC story considered. I find it kind of hard to reccommend, despite all the good things it had going. The whole story arc just left me feeling empty. If you're curious or not spoiled, go ahead and dig into it. After Infinite's ending, BaS episode 1 ending, and BaS episode 2 ending, you'll feel the burn. And then the emptiness.
